definition: to spread out/(fig.) to share equally
flat/level/equal/to tie (make the same score)/to draw (score)/calm/peaceful/see also 平聲|平声[ping2 sheng1]

sentences.english: If it’s a little more expensive, ask around for friends to chip in.
sentences.chinese: 如果这些有点贵，可以和朋友平摊。

sentences.english: Will you contribute in proportion to your incomes, or equally?
sentences.chinese: 家庭支出按收入比例，还是平摊？

sentences.english: And we can maybe share the cost of the gas together.
sentences.chinese: 我们也许可以平摊油费。

sentences.english: Let me go halves with you in the taxi fare.
sentences.chinese: 让我们平摊出租车费去那儿。

sentences.english: The remaining 15% should be assigned in equal pieces to your dreams.
sentences.chinese: 剩下的15%应该平摊到每个梦想中来。

sentences.english: Ex:My partner refused to go fifty-fifty with me in the loss.
sentences.chinese: 我的合伙人拒绝和我平摊损失。

sentences.english: 3Mary and I took a taxi to home from the party and split the fare.
sentences.chinese: 玛丽和我一起从晚会上乘出租车回家，车费平摊。

sentences.english: I’m afraid that we should divide the expenses equally.
sentences.chinese: 我想咱们应该平摊费用。

definition: (after a sum has been paid in advance) to refund (in case of overpayment) or be reimbursed (in case of underpayment)
rent for a room or house
expenditures/expenses/CL:筆|笔[bi3], 項|项[xiang4]/to spend money/(coll.) to pay wages
